docs.lead_paragraph: After an improbable rise from the Bronx projects to a job selling Gulf Coast homes, Isabel Bermudez lost it all to an epic housing bust -- the six-figure income, the house with the pool and the investment property. Now, as she papers the county with résumés and girds herself for rejection, she is supporting two daughters on an income that inspires a double take: zero dollars in monthly cash and a few hundred dollars in food stamps.

headline.main: Living on Nothing but Food Stamps

docs.abstract: Article in series The Safety Net, examining how social safety net is holding up during fiscal crisis, notes that about six million Americans receiving food stamps report they have no other income; number of people with no cash income was rising even before recession as tougher welfare laws made it harder for poor people to get cash aid, but it has soared about 50 percent in past two years; main cash welfare program has scarcely expanded during recession; its rolls are still down about 75 percent from their 1990s peak; food stamps, which are easier to get, have become safety net of last resort; critics say lack of cash support shows safety net is torn; maps; graphs; photos (L)

docs.lead_paragraph: Michael R. Bloomberg is a smart leader with sound priorities, but the next four years will test his political skills as mayor of a city with serious problems.
